page.title: 05TEKELS PARK.
page.content: Tekels Park consists of about 59 acres of land, grassland and houses. The Estate was formed around a large castle, built in the 19th Century, called Tekels Castle. Squire Tekel, the original owner,used the castle as a hunting lodge until 1863, when 333 acres of the park (including much of Camberley at that time) were bought by a Mr C. Knight. He built the Cambridge Hotel, and many roads in Camberley. The Castle grounds held stables and had peacocks and ornamental gardens- although the castle was burnt to the ground in 1910 most of the gardens still remain, and traces of the original castle too, although the estate has diminished in size. The park is now owned by the Theosophical Society, who own a guest house on the site. The meadow contains some rare grasses
